column4: I have two monitors. I'd like for different desktops to be associated with them, so that when I ctrl-alt-left or ctrl-alt-right, I'll move between the monitors. Can I do that?
Right now, if I have an application running on a desktop associated with one screen, I can't move it to the next (or at least, I don't know how).
Also, switching between the desktops associated with the different monitors appears to be accomplished by moving the mouse off the edge of the screen. But how do I do that with the keyboard?
Also, when I launch a new application, I don't know on which screen it will end up.
Help?
the keyboard is universlly available to both, the X server you have has simply stretch over 2 displays
I have four desktops associated with the left monitor session, and four with the right. I don't know how to move applications between them (only within each quartet).
just drag it over?
impossible.
you can have a seperate X screen on each but i am unsure of mouse / keyoard handling
could you find some tutorial for me? I'm not really good at looking those things up.
you'll be messing in xorg.conf LOTS
you will have to setup 4 video cards, 4 monitors, then 4 screens, then 1 server with teh 4 screens
didnt you say you had 4 monitors?
no. Just two. I have four /desktops/ associated with them. You know, those virtual desktops that come with Ubuntu by default?
oh i see
so? Is it possible?

so you will need 2 X servers then.
